# Recipe: Instapot Stuffed Bell Peppers

## Table of Contents
- [Introduction](#introduction)
- [Ingredients](#ingredients)
- [Equipment](#equipment)
- [Preparation Time](#preparation-time)
- [Cooking Time](#cooking-time)
- [Steps](#steps)
- [Serving Suggestions](#serving-suggestions)
- [Variations](#variations)
- [Tips and Tricks](#tips-and-tricks)
- [Nutritional Information](#nutritional-information)
- [Storage and Leftovers](#storage-and-leftovers)
- [Frequently Asked Questions](#frequently-asked-questions)

## Introduction
Instapot Stuffed Bell Peppers is a delicious and nutritious dish that combines the vibrant flavors of bell peppers with a savory filling. This recipe is a popular choice for those looking for a healthy and satisfying meal. Stuffed bell peppers can be enjoyed as a main course or as a side dish, making it a versatile option for any occasion.

## Ingredients
- 4 large bell peppers (any color)
- 1 pound ground beef (substitute with ground turkey or chicken for a leaner option)
- 1 cup cooked rice (white or brown)
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 cup tomato sauce
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/2 cup shredded cheese (cheddar, mozzarella, or your preferred cheese)
- Fresh parsley, for garnish

## Equipment
- Instant Pot or pressure cooker
- Knife
- Cutting board
- Spoon or spatula
- Measuring cups and spoons

## Preparation Time
- 15 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 15 minutes (plus additional time for the Instant Pot to come to pressure and release pressure)

## Steps
1. Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. Set aside.
2. In a skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned. Drain any excess fat.
3. Add the diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet with the ground beef. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the onion is softened.
4. Stir in the cooked rice, tomato sauce, dried oregano, dried basil, salt, and black pepper. Mix well to combine all the ingredients.
5. Stuff each bell pepper with the filling mixture, packing it tightly.
6. Pour 1 cup of water into the Instant Pot. Place the trivet inside the pot.
7. Carefully place the stuffed bell peppers on the trivet inside the Instant Pot.
8. Close the lid and set the Instant Pot to manual high pressure for 5 minutes.
9. Once the cooking time is complete, allow the pressure to release naturally for 5 minutes, then do a quick release.
10. Carefully remove the stuffed bell peppers from the Instant Pot using tongs.
11. Sprinkle shredded cheese on top of each bell pepper.
12. Place the stuffed bell peppers under the broiler for 2-3 minutes until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
13. Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the Instapot Stuffed Bell Peppers as a main course with a side salad or steamed vegetables.
- Pair it with a side of crusty bread or garlic bread for a complete meal.

## Variations
- Vegetarian option: Substitute the ground beef with cooked quinoa or lentils for a vegetarian version.
- Mexican-style: Add a can of black beans and corn to the filling mixture. Top with salsa and avocado for a Mexican twist.
- Mediterranean-style: Replace the ground beef with ground lamb or turkey. Add chopped olives, feta cheese, and fresh herbs like mint and parsley to the filling mixture.

## Tips and Tricks
- Choose bell peppers that are firm and have a vibrant color for the best flavor and texture.
- If the bell peppers are wobbly, slice a thin piece off the bottom to create a flat base for them to stand upright in the Instant Pot.
- Feel free to customize the filling by adding your favorite vegetables or spices.
- To make the dish spicier, add some crushed red pepper flakes or a dash of hot sauce to the filling mixture.

## Nutritional Information
- The nutritional information for this recipe may vary depending on the specific ingredients and substitutions used. Here is an approximate breakdown per serving:
  - Calories: 350
  - Fat: 15g
  - Carbohydrates: 30g
  - Protein: 24g
  - Fiber: 4g

## Storage and Leftovers
- Store any leftover stuffed bell peppers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- Reheat in the microwave or oven until heated through before serving.

## Frequently Asked Questions
1. Can I use a different type of meat?
   - Yes, you can use ground turkey, chicken, or even sausage instead of ground beef.
2. Can I freeze the stuffed bell peppers?
   - Yes, you can freeze the stuffed bell peppers before baking. Wrap each pepper tightly in plastic wrap and place them in a freezer-safe container. Thaw in the refrigerator before cooking as per the recipe instructions.
3. How can I make the dish less spicy?
   - If you prefer a milder flavor, omit the black pepper and reduce the amount of dried oregano and dried basil.
4. Can I make this recipe in a regular oven?
   - Yes, you can bake the stuffed bell peppers in a preheated oven at 375°F (190°C) for 25-30 minutes or until the peppers are tender and the filling is heated through.
5. Can I use a different type of cheese?
   - Absolutely! Feel free to use your favorite cheese or a combination of cheeses for the topping.
